4202  cresult+=pm(key,cpot2.get_tensor(),2);
4203  error+=pm.error;
4204  }
4205 
4206  if (have_eri()) {
4207  tensorT result1=cresult.full_tensor_copy();
4208  result1+=pm(key,copy(ceri(result->cdata.s0)));
4209  cresult=coeffT(result1,result->get_tensor_args());
4210  error+=pm.error;
4211  } else {
4212  cresult.reduce_rank(result->get_tensor_args().thresh);
4213  }
4214  if ((not have_v1()) and (not have_v2()) and (not have_eri())) {
4215  cresult=coeff_ket;
4216  }
4217 
4218  return std::make_pair(cresult,error);
4219  }
4220 
4221  this_type make_child(const keyT& child) const {
4222 
4223  // break key into particles
4224  Key<LDIM> key1, key2;
4225  child.break_apart(key1,key2);
4226 
4227  return this_type(result,leaf_op,iaket.make_child(child),
4228  iap1.make_child(key1),iap2.make_child(key2),
4229  iav1.make_child(key1),iav2.make_child(key2),eri);
4230  }
4231 
4232  Future<this_type> activate() const {
4233  Future<ctT> iaket1=iaket.activate();
4234  Future<ctL> iap11=iap1.activate();
4235  Future<ctL> iap21=iap2.activate();
4236  Future<ctL> iav11=iav1.activate();
4237  Future<ctL> iav21=iav2.activate();
4238  return result->world.taskq.add(detail::wrap_mem_fn(*const_cast<this_type *> (this),
4239  &this_type::forward_ctor),result,leaf_op,
4240  iaket1,iap11,iap21,iav11,iav21,eri);
4241  }
4242 
4243  this_type forward_ctor(implT* result1, const opT& leaf_op, const ctT& iaket1,
4244  const ctL& iap11, const ctL& iap21, const ctL& iav11, const ctL& iav21,
4245  const implT* eri1) {
4246  return this_type(result1,leaf_op,iaket1,iap11,iap21,iav11,iav21,eri1);
4247  }
4248 
4249  /// serialize this (needed for use in recursive_op)
4250  template <typename Archive> void serialize(const Archive& ar) {
4251  ar & iaket & eri & result & leaf_op & iap1 & iap2 & iav1 & iav2;
4252  }
4253  };
4254 
4255  /// assemble the function V*phi using V and phi given from the functor
4256 
4257  /// this function must have been constructed using the CompositeFunctorInterface.
4258  /// The interface provides one- and two-electron potentials, and the ket, which are
4259  /// assembled to give V*phi.
4260  /// @param[in] leaf_op operator to decide if a given node is a leaf node
4261  /// @param[in] fence global fence
4262  template<typename opT>
4263  void make_Vphi(const opT& leaf_op, const bool fence=true) {
4264 
4265  constexpr size_t LDIM=NDIM/2;
4266  MADNESS_CHECK_THROW(NDIM==LDIM*2,"make_Vphi only works for even dimensions");
4267 
4268 
4269  // keep the functor available, but remove it from the result
4270  // result will return false upon is_on_demand(), which is necessary for the
4271  // CoeffTracker to track the parent coeffs correctly for error_leaf_op
4272  std::shared_ptr< FunctionFunctorInterface<T,NDIM> > func2(this->get_functor());
4273  this->unset_functor();
4274 
4275  CompositeFunctorInterface<T,NDIM,LDIM>* func=
4276  dynamic_cast<CompositeFunctorInterface<T,NDIM,LDIM>* >(&(*func2));
4277  MADNESS_ASSERT(func);
4278 
4279  // make sure everything is in place if no fence is requested
4280  if (fence) func->make_redundant(true); // no-op if already redundant
4281  MADNESS_CHECK_THROW(func->check_redundant(),"make_Vphi requires redundant functions");
4282 
4283  // loop over all functions in the functor (either ket or particles)
4284  for (auto& ket : func->impl_ket_vector) {
4285  FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>* eri=func->impl_eri.get();
4286  FunctionImpl<T,LDIM>* v1=func->impl_m1.get();
4287  FunctionImpl<T,LDIM>* v2=func->impl_m2.get();
4288  FunctionImpl<T,LDIM>* p1=nullptr;
4289  FunctionImpl<T,LDIM>* p2=nullptr;
4290  make_Vphi_only(leaf_op,ket.get(),v1,v2,p1,p2,eri,false);
4291  }
4292 
4293  for (std::size_t i=0; i<func->impl_p1_vector.size(); ++i) {
4294  FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>* ket=nullptr;
4295  FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>* eri=func->impl_eri.get();
4296  FunctionImpl<T,LDIM>* v1=func->impl_m1.get();
4297  FunctionImpl<T,LDIM>* v2=func->impl_m2.get();
4298  FunctionImpl<T,LDIM>* p1=func->impl_p1_vector[i].get();
4299  FunctionImpl<T,LDIM>* p2=func->impl_p2_vector[i].get();
4300  make_Vphi_only(leaf_op,ket,v1,v2,p1,p2,eri,false);
4301  }
4302 
4303  // some post-processing:
4304  // - FunctionNode::accumulate() uses buffer -> add the buffer contents to the actual coefficients
4305  // - the operation constructs sum coefficients on all scales -> sum down to get a well-defined tree-state
4306  if (fence) {
4307  world.gop.fence();
4308  flo_unary_op_node_inplace(do_consolidate_buffer(get_tensor_args()),true);
4309  sum_down(true);
4310  set_tree_state(reconstructed);
4311  }
4312 
4313 
4314  }
4315 
4316  /// assemble the function V*phi using V and phi given from the functor
4317 
4318  /// this function must have been constructed using the CompositeFunctorInterface.
4319  /// The interface provides one- and two-electron potentials, and the ket, which are
4320  /// assembled to give V*phi.
4321  /// @param[in] leaf_op operator to decide if a given node is a leaf node
4322  /// @param[in] fence global fence
4323  template<typename opT, std::size_t LDIM>
4324  void make_Vphi_only(const opT& leaf_op, FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>* ket,
4325  FunctionImpl<T,LDIM>* v1, FunctionImpl<T,LDIM>* v2,
4326  FunctionImpl<T,LDIM>* p1, FunctionImpl<T,LDIM>* p2,
4327  FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>* eri,
4328  const bool fence=true) {
4329 
4330  // prepare the CoeffTracker
4331  CoeffTracker<T,NDIM> iaket(ket);
4332  CoeffTracker<T,LDIM> iap1(p1);
4333  CoeffTracker<T,LDIM> iap2(p2);
4334  CoeffTracker<T,LDIM> iav1(v1);
4335  CoeffTracker<T,LDIM> iav2(v2);
4336 
4337  // the operator making the coefficients
4338  typedef Vphi_op_NS<opT,LDIM> coeff_opT;
4339  coeff_opT coeff_op(this,leaf_op,iaket,iap1,iap2,iav1,iav2,eri);
4340 
4341  // this operator simply inserts the coeffs into this' tree
4342  typedef noop<T,NDIM> apply_opT;
4343  apply_opT apply_op;
4344 
4345  if (world.rank() == coeffs.owner(cdata.key0)) {
4346  woT::task(world.rank(), &implT:: template forward_traverse<coeff_opT,apply_opT>,
4347  coeff_op, apply_op, cdata.key0);
4348  }
4349 
4350  set_tree_state(redundant_after_merge);
4351  if (fence) world.gop.fence();
4352 
4353  }
4354 
4355  /// Permute the dimensions of f according to map, result on this
4356  void mapdim(const implT& f, const std::vector<long>& map, bool fence);
4357 
4358  /// mirror the dimensions of f according to map, result on this
4359  void mirror(const implT& f, const std::vector<long>& mirror, bool fence);
4360 
4361  /// map and mirror the translation index and the coefficients, result on this
4362 
4363  /// first map the dimensions, the mirror!
4364  /// this = mirror(map(f))
4365  void map_and_mirror(const implT& f, const std::vector<long>& map,
4366  const std::vector<long>& mirror, bool fence);
4367 
4368  /// take the average of two functions, similar to: this=0.5*(this+rhs)
4369 
4370  /// works in either basis and also in nonstandard form
4371  void average(const implT& rhs);
4372 
4373  /// change the tensor type of the coefficients in the FunctionNode
4374 
4375  /// @param[in] targs target tensor arguments (threshold and full/low rank)
4376  void change_tensor_type1(const TensorArgs& targs, bool fence);
4377 
4378  /// reduce the rank of the coefficients tensors
4379 
4380  /// @param[in] targs target tensor arguments (threshold and full/low rank)
4381  void reduce_rank(const double thresh, bool fence);
4382 
4383 
4384  /// remove all nodes with level higher than n
4385  void chop_at_level(const int n, const bool fence=true);
4386 
4387  /// compute norm of s and d coefficients for all nodes
4388  void compute_snorm_and_dnorm(bool fence=true);
4389 
4390  /// compute the norm of the wavelet coefficients
4391  struct do_compute_snorm_and_dnorm {
4392  typedef Range<typename dcT::iterator> rangeT;
4393 
4394  const FunctionCommonData<T,NDIM>& cdata;
4395  do_compute_snorm_and_dnorm(const FunctionCommonData<T,NDIM>& cdata) :
4396  cdata(cdata) {}
4397 
4398  bool operator()(typename rangeT::iterator& it) const {
4399  auto& node=it->second;
4400  node.recompute_snorm_and_dnorm(cdata);
4401  return true;
4402  }
4403  };
4404 
4405 
4406  T eval_cube(Level n, coordT& x, const tensorT& c) const;
4407 
4408  /// Transform sum coefficients at level n to sums+differences at level n-1
4409 
4410  /// Given scaling function coefficients s[n][l][i] and s[n][l+1][i]
4411  /// return the scaling function and wavelet coefficients at the
4412  /// coarser level. I.e., decompose Vn using Vn = Vn-1 + Wn-1.
4413  /// \code
4414  /// s_i = sum(j) h0_ij*s0_j + h1_ij*s1_j
4415  /// d_i = sum(j) g0_ij*s0_j + g1_ij*s1_j
4416  // \endcode
4417  /// Returns a new tensor and has no side effects. Works for any
4418  /// number of dimensions.
4419  ///
4420  /// No communication involved.
4421  tensorT filter(const tensorT& s) const;
4422 
4423  coeffT filter(const coeffT& s) const;
4424 
4425  /// Transform sums+differences at level n to sum coefficients at level n+1
4426 
4427  /// Given scaling function and wavelet coefficients (s and d)
4428  /// returns the scaling function coefficients at the next finer
4429  /// level. I.e., reconstruct Vn using Vn = Vn-1 + Wn-1.
4430  /// \code
4431  /// s0 = sum(j) h0_ji*s_j + g0_ji*d_j
4432  /// s1 = sum(j) h1_ji*s_j + g1_ji*d_j
4433  /// \endcode
4434  /// Returns a new tensor and has no side effects
4435  ///
4436  /// If (sonly) ... then ss is only the scaling function coeff (and
4437  /// assume the d are zero). Works for any number of dimensions.
4438  ///
4439  /// No communication involved.
4440  tensorT unfilter(const tensorT& s) const;
4441 
4442  coeffT unfilter(const coeffT& s) const;
4443 
4444  /// downsample the sum coefficients of level n+1 to sum coeffs on level n
4445 
4446  /// specialization of the filter method, will yield only the sum coefficients
4447  /// @param[in] key key of level n
4448  /// @param[in] v vector of sum coefficients of level n+1
4449  /// @return sum coefficients on level n in full tensor format
4450  tensorT downsample(const keyT& key, const std::vector< Future<coeffT > >& v) const;
4451 
4452  /// upsample the sum coefficients of level 1 to sum coeffs on level n+1
4453 
4454  /// specialization of the unfilter method, will transform only the sum coefficients
4455  /// @param[in] key key of level n+1
4456  /// @param[in] coeff sum coefficients of level n (does NOT belong to key!!)
4457  /// @return sum coefficients on level n+1
4458  coeffT upsample(const keyT& key, const coeffT& coeff) const;
4459 
4460  /// Projects old function into new basis (only in reconstructed form)
4461  void project(const implT& old, bool fence);
4462 
4463  struct true_refine_test {
4464  bool operator()(const implT* f, const keyT& key, const nodeT& t) const {
4465  return true;
4466  }
4467  template <typename Archive> void serialize(Archive& ar) {}
4468  };
4469 
4470  template <typename opT>
4471  void refine_op(const opT& op, const keyT& key) {
4472  // Must allow for someone already having autorefined the coeffs
4473  // and we get a write accessor just in case they are already executing
4474  typename dcT::accessor acc;
4475  const auto found = coeffs.find(acc,key);
4476  MADNESS_CHECK(found);
4477  nodeT& node = acc->second;
4478  if (node.has_coeff() && key.level() < max_refine_level && op(this, key, node)) {
4479  coeffT d(cdata.v2k,targs);
4480  d(cdata.s0) += copy(node.coeff());
4481  d = unfilter(d);
4482  node.clear_coeff();
4483  node.set_has_children(true);
4484  for (KeyChildIterator<NDIM> kit(key); kit; ++kit) {
4485  const keyT& child = kit.key();
4486  coeffT ss = copy(d(child_patch(child)));
4487  ss.reduce_rank(targs.thresh);
4488  // coeffs.replace(child,nodeT(ss,-1.0,false).node_to_low_rank());
4489  coeffs.replace(child,nodeT(ss,-1.0,false));
4490  // Note value -1.0 for norm tree to indicate result of refinement
4491  }
4492  }
4493  }
4494 
4495  template <typename opT>
4496  void refine_spawn(const opT& op, const keyT& key) {
4497  nodeT& node = coeffs.find(key).get()->second;
4498  if (node.has_children()) {
4499  for (KeyChildIterator<NDIM> kit(key); kit; ++kit)
4500  woT::task(coeffs.owner(kit.key()), &implT:: template refine_spawn<opT>, op, kit.key(), TaskAttributes::hipri());
4501  }
4502  else {
4503  woT::task(coeffs.owner(key), &implT:: template refine_op<opT>, op, key);
4504  }
4505  }
4506 
4507  // Refine in real space according to local user-defined criterion
4508  template <typename opT>
4509  void refine(const opT& op, bool fence) {
4510  if (world.rank() == coeffs.owner(cdata.key0))
4511  woT::task(coeffs.owner(cdata.key0), &implT:: template refine_spawn<opT>, op, cdata.key0, TaskAttributes::hipri());
4512  if (fence)
4513  world.gop.fence();
4514  }
4515 
4516  bool exists_and_has_children(const keyT& key) const;
4517 
4518  bool exists_and_is_leaf(const keyT& key) const;
4519 
4520 
4521  void broaden_op(const keyT& key, const std::vector< Future <bool> >& v);
4522 
4523  // For each local node sets value of norm tree, snorm and dnorm to 0.0
4524  void zero_norm_tree();
4525 
4526  // Broaden tree
4527  void broaden(std::vector<bool> is_periodic, bool fence);
4528 
4529  /// sum all the contributions from all scales after applying an operator in mod-NS form
4530  void trickle_down(bool fence);
4531 
4532  /// sum all the contributions from all scales after applying an operator in mod-NS form
4533 
4534  /// cf reconstruct_op
4535  void trickle_down_op(const keyT& key, const coeffT& s);
4536 
4537  /// reconstruct this tree -- respects fence
4538  void reconstruct(bool fence);
4539 
4540  void change_tree_state(const TreeState finalstate, bool fence=true);
4541 
4542  // Invoked on node where key is local
4543  // void reconstruct_op(const keyT& key, const tensorT& s);
4544  void reconstruct_op(const keyT& key, const coeffT& s, const bool accumulate_NS=true);
4545 
4546  /// compress the wave function
4547 
4548  /// after application there will be sum coefficients at the root level,
4549  /// and difference coefficients at all other levels; furthermore:
4550  /// @param[in] nonstandard keep sum coeffs at all other levels, except leaves
4551  /// @param[in] keepleaves keep sum coeffs (but no diff coeffs) at leaves
4552  /// @param[in] redundant keep only sum coeffs at all levels, discard difference coeffs
4553 // void compress(bool nonstandard, bool keepleaves, bool redundant, bool fence);
4554  void compress(const TreeState newstate, bool fence);
4555 
4556  /// Invoked on node where key is local
4557  Future<std::pair<coeffT,double> > compress_spawn(const keyT& key, bool nonstandard, bool keepleaves,
4558  bool redundant1);
4559 
4560  private:
4561  /// convert this to redundant, i.e. have sum coefficients on all levels
4562  void make_redundant(const bool fence);
4563  public:
4564 
4565  /// convert this from redundant to standard reconstructed form
4566  void undo_redundant(const bool fence);
4567 
4568  void remove_internal_coefficients(const bool fence);
4569  void remove_leaf_coefficients(const bool fence);
4570 
4571 
4572  /// compute for each FunctionNode the norm of the function inside that node
4573  void norm_tree(bool fence);
4574 
4575  double norm_tree_op(const keyT& key, const std::vector< Future<double> >& v);
4576 
4577  Future<double> norm_tree_spawn(const keyT& key);
4578 
4579  /// truncate using a tree in reconstructed form
4580 
4581  /// must be invoked where key is local
4582  Future<coeffT> truncate_reconstructed_spawn(const keyT& key, const double tol);
4583 
4584  /// given the sum coefficients of all children, truncate or not
4585 
4586  /// @return new sum coefficients (empty if internal, not empty, if new leaf); might delete its children
4587  coeffT truncate_reconstructed_op(const keyT& key, const std::vector< Future<coeffT > >& v, const double tol);
4588 
4589  /// calculate the wavelet coefficients using the sum coefficients of all child nodes
4590 
4591  /// also compute the norm tree for all nodes
4592  /// @param[in] key this's key
4593  /// @param[in] v sum coefficients of the child nodes
4594  /// @param[in] nonstandard keep the sum coefficients with the wavelet coefficients
4595  /// @param[in] redundant keep only the sum coefficients, discard the wavelet coefficients
4596  /// @return the sum coefficients
4597  std::pair<coeffT,double> compress_op(const keyT& key, const std::vector< Future<std::pair<coeffT,double>> >& v, bool nonstandard);
4598 
4599 
4600  /// similar to compress_op, but insert only the sum coefficients in the tree
4601 
4602  /// also compute the norm tree for all nodes
4603  /// @param[in] key this's key
4604  /// @param[in] v sum coefficients of the child nodes
4605  /// @return the sum coefficients
4606  std::pair<coeffT,double> make_redundant_op(const keyT& key,const std::vector< Future<std::pair<coeffT,double> > >& v);
4607 
4608  /// Changes non-standard compressed form to standard compressed form
4609  void standard(bool fence);
4610 
4611  /// Changes non-standard compressed form to standard compressed form
4612  struct do_standard {
4613  typedef Range<typename dcT::iterator> rangeT;
4614 
4615  // threshold for rank reduction / SVD truncation
4616  implT* impl;
4617 
4618  // constructor takes target precision
4619  do_standard() {}
4620  do_standard(implT* impl) : impl(impl) {}
4621 
4622  //
4623  bool operator()(typename rangeT::iterator& it) const {
4624 
4625  const keyT& key = it->first;
4626  nodeT& node = it->second;
4627  if (key.level()> 0 && node.has_coeff()) {
4628  if (node.has_children()) {
4629  // Zero out scaling coeffs
4630  MADNESS_ASSERT(node.coeff().dim(0)==2*impl->get_k());
4631  node.coeff()(impl->cdata.s0)=0.0;
4632  node.reduceRank(impl->targs.thresh);
4633  } else {
4634  // Deleting both scaling and wavelet coeffs
4635  node.clear_coeff();
4636  }
4637  }
4638  return true;
4639  }
4640  template <typename Archive> void serialize(const Archive& ar) {
4641  MADNESS_EXCEPTION("no serialization of do_standard",1);
4642  }
4643  };
4644 
4645 
4646  /// laziness
4647  template<size_t OPDIM>
4648  struct do_op_args {
4649  Key<OPDIM> key,d;
4650  keyT dest;
4651  double tol, fac, cnorm;
4652  do_op_args() {}
4653  do_op_args(const Key<OPDIM>& key, const Key<OPDIM>& d, const keyT& dest, double tol, double fac, double cnorm)
4654  : key(key), d(d), dest(dest), tol(tol), fac(fac), cnorm(cnorm) {}
4655  template <class Archive>
4656  void serialize(Archive& ar) {
4657  ar & archive::wrap_opaque(this,1);
4658  }
4659  };
4660 
4661  /// for fine-grain parallelism: call the apply method of an operator in a separate task
4662 
4663  /// @param[in] op the operator working on our function
4664  /// @param[in] c full rank tensor holding the NS coefficients
4665  /// @param[in] args laziness holding norm of the coefficients, displacement, destination, ..
4666  template <typename opT, typename R, size_t OPDIM>
4667  void do_apply_kernel(const opT* op, const Tensor<R>& c, const do_op_args<OPDIM>& args) {
4668 
4669  tensorT result = op->apply(args.key, args.d, c, args.tol/args.fac/args.cnorm);
4670 
4671  // Screen here to reduce communication cost of negligible data
4672  // and also to ensure we don't needlessly widen the tree when
4673  // applying the operator
4674  if (result.normf()> 0.3*args.tol/args.fac) {
4675  coeffs.task(args.dest, &nodeT::accumulate2, result, coeffs, args.dest, TaskAttributes::hipri());
4676  //woT::task(world.rank(),&implT::accumulate_timer,time,TaskAttributes::hipri());
4677  // UGLY BUT ADDED THE OPTIMIZATION BACK IN HERE EXPLICITLY/
4678  if (args.dest == world.rank()) {
4679  coeffs.send(args.dest, &nodeT::accumulate, result, coeffs, args.dest);
4680  }
4681  else {
4682  coeffs.task(args.dest, &nodeT::accumulate, result, coeffs, args.dest, TaskAttributes::hipri());
4683  }
4684  }
4685  }
4686 
4687  /// same as do_apply_kernel, but use full rank tensors as input and low rank tensors as output
4688 
4689  /// @param[in] op the operator working on our function
4690  /// @param[in] c full rank tensor holding the NS coefficients
4691  /// @param[in] args laziness holding norm of the coefficients, displacement, destination, ..
4692  /// @param[in] apply_targs TensorArgs with tightened threshold for accumulation
4693  /// @return nothing, but accumulate the result tensor into the destination node
4694  template <typename opT, typename R, size_t OPDIM>
4695  double do_apply_kernel2(const opT* op, const Tensor<R>& c, const do_op_args<OPDIM>& args,
4696  const TensorArgs& apply_targs) {
4697 
4698  tensorT result_full = op->apply(args.key, args.d, c, args.tol/args.fac/args.cnorm);
4699  const double norm=result_full.normf();
4700 
4701  // Screen here to reduce communication cost of negligible data
4702  // and also to ensure we don't needlessly widen the tree when
4703  // applying the operator
4704  // OPTIMIZATION NEEDED HERE ... CHANGING THIS TO TASK NOT SEND REMOVED
4705  // BUILTIN OPTIMIZATION TO SHORTCIRCUIT MSG IF DATA IS LOCAL
4706  if (norm > 0.3*args.tol/args.fac) {
4707 
4708  small++;
4709  //double cpu0=cpu_time();
4710  coeffT result=coeffT(result_full,apply_targs);
4711  MADNESS_ASSERT(result.is_full_tensor() or result.is_svd_tensor());
4712  //double cpu1=cpu_time();
4713  //timer_lr_result.accumulate(cpu1-cpu0);
4714 
4715  coeffs.task(args.dest, &nodeT::accumulate, result, coeffs, args.dest, apply_targs,
4716  TaskAttributes::hipri());
4717 
4718  //woT::task(world.rank(),&implT::accumulate_timer,time,TaskAttributes::hipri());
4719  }
4720  return norm;
4721  }
4722 
4723 
4724 
4725  /// same as do_apply_kernel2, but use low rank tensors as input and low rank tensors as output
4726 
4727  /// @param[in] op the operator working on our function
4728  /// @param[in] coeff full rank tensor holding the NS coefficients
4729  /// @param[in] args laziness holding norm of the coefficients, displacement, destination, ..
4730  /// @param[in] apply_targs TensorArgs with tightened threshold for accumulation
4731  /// @return nothing, but accumulate the result tensor into the destination node
4732  template <typename opT, typename R, size_t OPDIM>
4733  double do_apply_kernel3(const opT* op, const GenTensor<R>& coeff, const do_op_args<OPDIM>& args,
4734  const TensorArgs& apply_targs) {
4735 
4736  coeffT result;
4737  if (2*OPDIM==NDIM) result= op->apply2_lowdim(args.key, args.d, coeff,
4738  args.tol/args.fac/args.cnorm, args.tol/args.fac);
4739  if (OPDIM==NDIM) result = op->apply2(args.key, args.d, coeff,
4740  args.tol/args.fac/args.cnorm, args.tol/args.fac);
4741 
4742  const double result_norm=result.svd_normf();
4743 
4744  if (result_norm> 0.3*args.tol/args.fac) {
4745  small++;
4746 
4747  double cpu0=cpu_time();
4748  if (not result.is_of_tensortype(targs.tt)) result=result.convert(targs);
4749  double cpu1=cpu_time();
4750  timer_lr_result.accumulate(cpu1-cpu0);
4751 
4752  // accumulate also expects result in SVD form
4753  coeffs.task(args.dest, &nodeT::accumulate, result, coeffs, args.dest, apply_targs,
4754  TaskAttributes::hipri());
4755 // woT::task(world.rank(),&implT::accumulate_timer,time,TaskAttributes::hipri());
4756 
4757  }
4758  return result_norm;
4759 
4760  }
4761 
4762  // volume of n-dimensional sphere of radius R
4763  double vol_nsphere(int n, double R) {
4764  return std::pow(madness::constants::pi,n*0.5)*std::pow(R,n)/std::tgamma(1+0.5*n);
4765  }
4766 
4767 
4768  /// apply an operator on the coeffs c (at node key)
4769 
4770  /// the result is accumulated inplace to this's tree at various FunctionNodes
4771  /// @param[in] op the operator to act on the source function
4772  /// @param[in] key key of the source FunctionNode of f which is processed
4773  /// @param[in] c coeffs of the FunctionNode of f which is processed
4774  template <typename opT, typename R>
4775  void do_apply(const opT* op, const keyT& key, const Tensor<R>& c) {
4776  PROFILE_MEMBER_FUNC(FunctionImpl);
4777 
4778  // working assumption here WAS that the operator is
4779  // isotropic and montonically decreasing with distance
4780  // ... however, now we are using derivative Gaussian
4781  // expansions (and also non-cubic boxes) isotropic is
4782  // violated. While not strictly monotonically decreasing,
4783  // the derivative gaussian is still such that once it
4784  // becomes negligible we are in the asymptotic region.
4785 
4786  typedef typename opT::keyT opkeyT;
4787  static const size_t opdim=opT::opdim;
4788  const opkeyT source=op->get_source_key(key);
4789 
4790 
4791  // Tuning here is based on observation that with
4792  // sufficiently high-order wavelet relative to the
4793  // precision, that only nearest neighbor boxes contribute,
4794  // whereas for low-order wavelets more neighbors will
4795  // contribute. Sufficiently high is picked as
4796  // k>=2-log10(eps) which is our empirical rule for
4797  // efficiency/accuracy and code instrumentation has
4798  // previously indicated that (in 3D) just unit
4799  // displacements are invoked. The error decays as R^-(k+1),
4800  // and the number of boxes increases as R^d.
4801  //
4802  // Fac is the expected number of contributions to a given
4803  // box, so the error permitted per contribution will be
4804  // tol/fac
4805 
4806  // radius of shell (nearest neighbor is diameter of 3 boxes, so radius=1.5)
4807  double radius = 1.5 + 0.33*std::max(0.0,2-std::log10(thresh)-k); // 0.33 was 0.5
4808  double fac = vol_nsphere(NDIM, radius);
4809  //previously fac=10.0 selected empirically constrained by qmprop
4810 
4811  double cnorm = c.normf();
4812 
4813  const std::vector<opkeyT>& disp = op->get_disp(key.level()); // list of displacements sorted in orer of increasing distance
4814  const std::vector<bool> is_periodic(NDIM,false); // Periodic sum is already done when making rnlp
4815  int nvalid=1; // Counts #valid at each distance
4816  int nused=1; // Counts #used at each distance
4817  uint64_t distsq = 99999999999999;
4818  for (typename std::vector<opkeyT>::const_iterator it=disp.begin(); it != disp.end(); ++it) {
4819  keyT d;
4820  Key<NDIM-opdim> nullkey(key.level());
4821  if (op->particle()==1) d=it->merge_with(nullkey);
4822  if (op->particle()==2) d=nullkey.merge_with(*it);
4823 
4824  uint64_t dsq = d.distsq();
4825  if (dsq != distsq) { // Moved to next shell of neighbors
4826  if (nvalid > 0 && nused == 0 && dsq > 1) {
4827  // Have at least done the input box and all first
4828  // nearest neighbors, and for all of the last set
4829  // of neighbors had no contribution. Thus,
4830  // assuming monotonic decrease, we are done.
4831  break;
4832  }
4833  nused = 0;
4834  nvalid = 0;
4835  distsq = dsq;
4836  }
4837 
4838  keyT dest = neighbor(key, d, is_periodic);
4839  if (dest.is_valid()) {
4840  nvalid++;
4841  double opnorm = op->norm(key.level(), *it, source);
4842  double tol = truncate_tol(thresh, key);
4843 
4844  if (cnorm*opnorm> tol/fac) {
4845  nused++;
4846  tensorT result = op->apply(source, *it, c, tol/fac/cnorm);
4847  if (result.normf() > 0.3*tol/fac) {
4848  if (coeffs.is_local(dest))
4849  coeffs.send(dest, &nodeT::accumulate2, result, coeffs, dest);
4850  else
4851  coeffs.task(dest, &nodeT::accumulate2, result, coeffs, dest);
4852  }
4853  }
4854  }
4855  }
4856  }
4857 
4858 
4859  /// apply an operator on f to return this
4860  template <typename opT, typename R>
4861  void apply(opT& op, const FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>& f, bool fence) {
4862  PROFILE_MEMBER_FUNC(FunctionImpl);
4863  MADNESS_ASSERT(!op.modified());
4864  typename dcT::const_iterator end = f.coeffs.end();
4865  for (typename dcT::const_iterator it=f.coeffs.begin(); it!=end; ++it) {
4866  // looping through all the coefficients in the source
4867  const keyT& key = it->first;
4868  const FunctionNode<R,NDIM>& node = it->second;
4869  if (node.has_coeff()) {
4870  if (node.coeff().dim(0) != k || op.doleaves) {
4871  ProcessID p = FunctionDefaults<NDIM>::get_apply_randomize() ? world.random_proc() : coeffs.owner(key);
4872 // woT::task(p, &implT:: template do_apply<opT,R>, &op, key, node.coeff()); //.full_tensor_copy() ????? why copy ????
4873  woT::task(p, &implT:: template do_apply<opT,R>, &op, key, node.coeff().reconstruct_tensor());
4874  }
4875  }
4876  }
4877  if (fence)
4878  world.gop.fence();
4879 
4880  set_tree_state(nonstandard_after_apply);
4881 // this->compressed=true;
4882 // this->nonstandard=true;
4883 // this->redundant=false;
4884 
4885  }
4886 
4887 
4888 
4889  /// apply an operator on the coeffs c (at node key)
4890 
4891  /// invoked by result; the result is accumulated inplace to this's tree at various FunctionNodes
4892  /// @param[in] op the operator to act on the source function
4893  /// @param[in] key key of the source FunctionNode of f which is processed (see "source")
4894  /// @param[in] coeff coeffs of FunctionNode being processed
4895  /// @param[in] do_kernel true: do the 0-disp only; false: do everything but the kernel
4896  /// @return max norm, and will modify or include new nodes in this' tree
4897  template <typename opT, typename R>
4898  double do_apply_directed_screening(const opT* op, const keyT& key, const coeffT& coeff,
4899  const bool& do_kernel) {
4900  PROFILE_MEMBER_FUNC(FunctionImpl);
4901  // insert timer here
4902  typedef typename opT::keyT opkeyT;
4903 
4904  // screening: contains all displacement keys that had small result norms
4905  std::list<opkeyT> blacklist;
4906 
4907  static const size_t opdim=opT::opdim;
4908  Key<NDIM-opdim> nullkey(key.level());
4909 
4910  // source is that part of key that corresponds to those dimensions being processed
4911  const opkeyT source=op->get_source_key(key);
4912 
4913  const double tol = truncate_tol(thresh, key);
4914 
4915  // fac is the root of the number of contributing neighbors (1st shell)
4916  double fac=std::pow(3,NDIM*0.5);
4917  double cnorm = coeff.normf();
4918 
4919  // for accumulation: keep slightly tighter TensorArgs
4920  TensorArgs apply_targs(targs);
4921  apply_targs.thresh=tol/fac*0.03;
4922 
4923  double maxnorm=0.0;
4924 
4925  // for the kernel it may be more efficient to do the convolution in full rank
4926  tensorT coeff_full;
4927  // for partial application (exchange operator) it's more efficient to
4928  // do SVD tensors instead of tensortrains, because addition in apply
4929  // can be done in full form for the specific particle
4930  coeffT coeff_SVD=coeff.convert(TensorArgs(-1.0,TT_2D));
4931 #ifdef HAVE_GENTENSOR
4932  coeff_SVD.get_svdtensor().orthonormalize(tol*GenTensor<T>::fac_reduce());
4933 #endif
4934 
4935  const std::vector<opkeyT>& disp = op->get_disp(key.level());
4936  const std::vector<bool> is_periodic(NDIM,false); // Periodic sum is already done when making rnlp
4937 
4938  for (typename std::vector<opkeyT>::const_iterator it=disp.begin(); it != disp.end(); ++it) {
4939  const opkeyT& d = *it;
4940 
4941  const int shell=d.distsq();
4942  if (do_kernel and (shell>0)) break;
4943  if ((not do_kernel) and (shell==0)) continue;
4944 
4945  keyT disp1;
4946  if (op->particle()==1) disp1=it->merge_with(nullkey);
4947  else if (op->particle()==2) disp1=nullkey.merge_with(*it);
4948  else {
4949  MADNESS_EXCEPTION("confused particle in operato??",1);
4950  }
4951 
4952  keyT dest = neighbor(key, disp1, is_periodic);
4953 
4954  if (not dest.is_valid()) continue;
4955 
4956  // directed screening
4957  // working assumption here is that the operator is isotropic and
4958  // monotonically decreasing with distance
4959  bool screened=false;
4960  typename std::list<opkeyT>::const_iterator it2;
4961  for (it2=blacklist.begin(); it2!=blacklist.end(); it2++) {
4962  if (d.is_farther_out_than(*it2)) {
4963  screened=true;
4964  break;
4965  }
4966  }
4967  if (not screened) {
4968 
4969  double opnorm = op->norm(key.level(), d, source);
4970  double norm=0.0;
4971 
4972  if (cnorm*opnorm> tol/fac) {
4973 
4974  double cost_ratio=op->estimate_costs(source, d, coeff_SVD, tol/fac/cnorm, tol/fac);
4975  // cost_ratio=1.5; // force low rank
4976  // cost_ratio=0.5; // force full rank
4977 
4978  if (cost_ratio>0.0) {
4979 
4980  do_op_args<opdim> args(source, d, dest, tol, fac, cnorm);
4981  norm=0.0;
4982  if (cost_ratio<1.0) {
4983  if (not coeff_full.has_data()) coeff_full=coeff.full_tensor_copy();
4984  norm=do_apply_kernel2(op, coeff_full,args,apply_targs);
4985  } else {
4986  if (2*opdim==NDIM) { // apply operator on one particle only
4987  norm=do_apply_kernel3(op,coeff_SVD,args,apply_targs);
4988  } else {
4989  norm=do_apply_kernel3(op,coeff,args,apply_targs);
4990  }
4991  }
4992  maxnorm=std::max(norm,maxnorm);
4993  }
4994 
4995  } else if (shell >= 12) {
4996  break; // Assumes monotonic decay beyond nearest neighbor
4997  }
4998  if (norm<0.3*tol/fac) blacklist.push_back(d);
4999  }
5000  }
5001  return maxnorm;
5002  }
5003 
5004 
5005  /// similar to apply, but for low rank coeffs
5006  template <typename opT, typename R>
5007  void apply_source_driven(opT& op, const FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>& f, bool fence) {
5008  PROFILE_MEMBER_FUNC(FunctionImpl);
5009 
5010  MADNESS_ASSERT(not op.modified());
5011  // looping through all the coefficients of the source f
5012  typename dcT::const_iterator end = f.get_coeffs().end();
5013  for (typename dcT::const_iterator it=f.get_coeffs().begin(); it!=end; ++it) {
5014 
5015  const keyT& key = it->first;
5016  const coeffT& coeff = it->second.coeff();
5017 
5018  if (coeff.has_data() and (coeff.rank()!=0)) {
5019  ProcessID p = FunctionDefaults<NDIM>::get_apply_randomize() ? world.random_proc() : coeffs.owner(key);
5020  woT::task(p, &implT:: template do_apply_directed_screening<opT,R>, &op, key, coeff, true);
5021  woT::task(p, &implT:: template do_apply_directed_screening<opT,R>, &op, key, coeff, false);
5022  }
5023  }
5024  if (fence) world.gop.fence();
5025  set_tree_state(TreeState::nonstandard_after_apply);
5026  }
5027 
5028  /// after apply we need to do some cleanup;
5029 
5030  /// forces fence
5031  double finalize_apply();
5032 
5033  /// after summing up we need to do some cleanup;
5034 
5035  /// forces fence
5036  void finalize_sum();
5037 
5038  /// traverse a non-existing tree, make its coeffs and apply an operator
5039 
5040  /// invoked by result
5041  /// here we use the fact that the hi-dim NS coefficients on all scales are exactly
5042  /// the outer product of the underlying low-dim functions (also in NS form),
5043  /// so we don't need to construct the full hi-dim tree and then turn it into NS form.
5044  /// @param[in] apply_op the operator acting on the NS tree
5045  /// @param[in] fimpl the funcimpl of the function of particle 1
5046  /// @param[in] gimpl the funcimpl of the function of particle 2
5047  template<typename opT, std::size_t LDIM>
5048  void recursive_apply(opT& apply_op, const FunctionImpl<T,LDIM>* fimpl,
5049  const FunctionImpl<T,LDIM>* gimpl, const bool fence) {
5050 
5051  //print("IN RECUR2");
5052  const keyT& key0=cdata.key0;
5053 
5054  if (world.rank() == coeffs.owner(key0)) {
5055 
5056  CoeffTracker<T,LDIM> ff(fimpl);
5057  CoeffTracker<T,LDIM> gg(gimpl);
5058 
5059  typedef recursive_apply_op<opT,LDIM> coeff_opT;
5060  coeff_opT coeff_op(this,ff,gg,&apply_op);
5061 
5062  typedef noop<T,NDIM> apply_opT;
5063  apply_opT apply_op;
5064 
5065  ProcessID p= coeffs.owner(key0);
5066  woT::task(p, &implT:: template forward_traverse<coeff_opT,apply_opT>, coeff_op, apply_op, key0);
5067 
5068  }
5069  if (fence) world.gop.fence();
5070  set_tree_state(TreeState::nonstandard_after_apply);
5071  }
5072 
5073  /// recursive part of recursive_apply
5074  template<typename opT, std::size_t LDIM>
5075  struct recursive_apply_op {
5076  bool randomize() const {return true;}
5077 
5078  typedef recursive_apply_op<opT,LDIM> this_type;
5079 
5080  implT* result;
5081  CoeffTracker<T,LDIM> iaf;
5082  CoeffTracker<T,LDIM> iag;
5083  opT* apply_op;
5084 
5085  // ctor
5086  recursive_apply_op() {}
5087  recursive_apply_op(implT* result,
5088  const CoeffTracker<T,LDIM>& iaf, const CoeffTracker<T,LDIM>& iag,
5089  const opT* apply_op) : result(result), iaf(iaf), iag(iag), apply_op(apply_op)
5090  {
5091  MADNESS_ASSERT(LDIM+LDIM==NDIM);
5092  }
5093  recursive_apply_op(const recursive_apply_op& other) : result(other.result), iaf(other.iaf),
5094  iag(other.iag), apply_op(other.apply_op) {}
5095 
5096 
5097  /// make the NS-coefficients and send off the application of the operator
5098 
5099  /// @return a Future<bool,coeffT>(is_leaf,coeffT())
5100  std::pair<bool,coeffT> operator()(const Key<NDIM>& key) const {
5101 
5102  // World& world=result->world;
5103  // break key into particles (these are the child keys, with datum1/2 come the parent keys)
5104  Key<LDIM> key1,key2;
5105  key.break_apart(key1,key2);
5106 
5107  // the lo-dim functions should be in full tensor form
5108  const tensorT fcoeff=iaf.coeff(key1).full_tensor();
5109  const tensorT gcoeff=iag.coeff(key2).full_tensor();
5110 
5111  // would this be a leaf node? If so, then its sum coeffs have already been
5112  // processed by the parent node's wavelet coeffs. Therefore we won't
5113  // process it any more.
5114  hartree_leaf_op<T,NDIM> leaf_op(result,result->get_k());
5115  bool is_leaf=leaf_op(key,fcoeff,gcoeff);
5116 
5117  if (not is_leaf) {
5118  // new coeffs are simply the hartree/kronecker/outer product --
5119  const std::vector<Slice>& s0=iaf.get_impl()->cdata.s0;
5120  const coeffT coeff = (apply_op->modified())
5121  ? outer(copy(fcoeff(s0)),copy(gcoeff(s0)),result->targs)
5122  : outer(fcoeff,gcoeff,result->targs);
5123 
5124  // now send off the application
5125  tensorT coeff_full;
5126  ProcessID p=result->world.rank();
5127  double norm0=result->do_apply_directed_screening<opT,T>(apply_op, key, coeff, true);
5128 
5129  result->task(p,&implT:: template do_apply_directed_screening<opT,T>,
5130  apply_op,key,coeff,false);
5131 
5132  return finalize(norm0,key,coeff);
5133 
5134  } else {
5135  return std::pair<bool,coeffT> (is_leaf,coeffT());
5136  }
5137  }
5138 
5139  /// sole purpose is to wait for the kernel norm, wrap it and send it back to caller
5140  std::pair<bool,coeffT> finalize(const double kernel_norm, const keyT& key,
5141  const coeffT& coeff) const {
5142  const double thresh=result->get_thresh()*0.1;
5143  bool is_leaf=(kernel_norm<result->truncate_tol(thresh,key));
5144  if (key.level()<2) is_leaf=false;
5145  return std::pair<bool,coeffT> (is_leaf,coeff);
5146  }
5147 
5148 
5149  this_type make_child(const keyT& child) const {
5150 
5151  // break key into particles
5152  Key<LDIM> key1, key2;
5153  child.break_apart(key1,key2);
5154 
5155  return this_type(result,iaf.make_child(key1),iag.make_child(key2),apply_op);
5156  }
5157 
5158  Future<this_type> activate() const {
5159  Future<CoeffTracker<T,LDIM> > f1=iaf.activate();
5160  Future<CoeffTracker<T,LDIM> > g1=iag.activate();
5161  return result->world.taskq.add(detail::wrap_mem_fn(*const_cast<this_type *> (this),
5162  &this_type::forward_ctor),result,f1,g1,apply_op);
5163  }
5164 
5165  this_type forward_ctor(implT* r, const CoeffTracker<T,LDIM>& f1, const CoeffTracker<T,LDIM>& g1,
5166  const opT* apply_op1) {
5167  return this_type(r,f1,g1,apply_op1);
5168  }
5169 
5170  template <typename Archive> void serialize(const Archive& ar) {
5171  ar & result & iaf & iag & apply_op;
5172  }
5173  };
5174 
5175  /// traverse an existing tree and apply an operator
5176 
5177  /// invoked by result
5178  /// @param[in] apply_op the operator acting on the NS tree
5179  /// @param[in] fimpl the funcimpl of the source function
5180  /// @param[in] rimpl a dummy function for recursive_op to insert data
5181  template<typename opT>
5182  void recursive_apply(opT& apply_op, const implT* fimpl, implT* rimpl, const bool fence) {
5183 
5184  print("IN RECUR1");
5185 
5186  const keyT& key0=cdata.key0;
5187 
5188  if (world.rank() == coeffs.owner(key0)) {
5189 
5190  typedef recursive_apply_op2<opT> coeff_opT;
5191  coeff_opT coeff_op(this,fimpl,&apply_op);
5192 
5193  typedef noop<T,NDIM> apply_opT;
5194  apply_opT apply_op;
5195 
5196  woT::task(world.rank(), &implT:: template forward_traverse<coeff_opT,apply_opT>,
5197  coeff_op, apply_op, cdata.key0);
5198 
5199  }
5200  if (fence) world.gop.fence();
5201  set_tree_state(TreeState::nonstandard_after_apply);
5202  }
5203 
5204  /// recursive part of recursive_apply
5205  template<typename opT>
5206  struct recursive_apply_op2 {
5207  bool randomize() const {return true;}
5208 
5209  typedef recursive_apply_op2<opT> this_type;
5210  typedef CoeffTracker<T,NDIM> ctT;
5211  typedef std::pair<bool,coeffT> argT;
5212 
5213  mutable implT* result;
5214  ctT iaf; /// need this for randomization
5215  const opT* apply_op;
5216 
5217  // ctor
5218  recursive_apply_op2() {}
5219  recursive_apply_op2(implT* result, const ctT& iaf, const opT* apply_op)
5220  : result(result), iaf(iaf), apply_op(apply_op) {}
5221 
5222  recursive_apply_op2(const recursive_apply_op2& other) : result(other.result),
5223  iaf(other.iaf), apply_op(other.apply_op) {}
5224 
5225 
5226  /// send off the application of the operator
5227 
5228  /// the first (core) neighbor (ie. the box itself) is processed
5229  /// immediately, all other ones are shoved into the taskq
5230  /// @return a pair<bool,coeffT>(is_leaf,coeffT())
5231  argT operator()(const Key<NDIM>& key) const {
5232 
5233  const coeffT& coeff=iaf.coeff();
5234 
5235  if (coeff.has_data()) {
5236 
5237  // now send off the application for all neighbor boxes
5238  ProcessID p=result->world.rank();
5239  result->task(p,&implT:: template do_apply_directed_screening<opT,T>,
5240  apply_op, key, coeff, false);
5241 
5242  // process the core box
5243  double norm0=result->do_apply_directed_screening<opT,T>(apply_op,key,coeff,true);
5244 
5245  if (iaf.is_leaf()) return argT(true,coeff);
5246  return finalize(norm0,key,coeff,result);
5247 
5248  } else {
5249  const bool is_leaf=true;
5250  return argT(is_leaf,coeffT());
5251  }
5252  }
5253 
5254  /// sole purpose is to wait for the kernel norm, wrap it and send it back to caller
5255  argT finalize(const double kernel_norm, const keyT& key,
5256  const coeffT& coeff, const implT* r) const {
5257  const double thresh=r->get_thresh()*0.1;
5258  bool is_leaf=(kernel_norm<r->truncate_tol(thresh,key));
5259  if (key.level()<2) is_leaf=false;
5260  return argT(is_leaf,coeff);
5261  }
5262 
5263 
5264  this_type make_child(const keyT& child) const {
5265  return this_type(result,iaf.make_child(child),apply_op);
5266  }
5267 
5268  /// retrieve the coefficients (parent coeffs might be remote)
5269  Future<this_type> activate() const {
5270  Future<ctT> f1=iaf.activate();
5271 
5272 // Future<ctL> g1=g.activate();
5273 // return h->world.taskq.add(detail::wrap_mem_fn(*const_cast<this_type *> (this),
5274 // &this_type::forward_ctor),h,f1,g1,particle);
5275 
5276  return result->world.taskq.add(detail::wrap_mem_fn(*const_cast<this_type *> (this),
5277  &this_type::forward_ctor),result,f1,apply_op);
5278  }
5279 
5280  /// taskq-compatible ctor
5281  this_type forward_ctor(implT* result1, const ctT& iaf1, const opT* apply_op1) {
5282  return this_type(result1,iaf1,apply_op1);
5283  }
5284 
5285  template <typename Archive> void serialize(const Archive& ar) {
5286  ar & result & iaf & apply_op;
5287  }
5288  };
5289 
5290  /// Returns the square of the error norm in the box labeled by key
5291 
5292  /// Assumed to be invoked locally but it would be easy to eliminate
5293  /// this assumption
5294  template <typename opT>
5295  double err_box(const keyT& key, const nodeT& node, const opT& func,
5296  int npt, const Tensor<double>& qx, const Tensor<double>& quad_phit,
5297  const Tensor<double>& quad_phiw) const {
5298 
5299  std::vector<long> vq(NDIM);
5300  for (std::size_t i=0; i<NDIM; ++i)
5301  vq[i] = npt;
5302  tensorT fval(vq,false), work(vq,false), result(vq,false);
5303 
5304  // Compute the "exact" function in this volume at npt points
5305  // where npt is usually this->npt+1.
5306  fcube(key, func, qx, fval);
5307 
5308  // Transform into the scaling function basis of order npt
5309  double scale = pow(0.5,0.5*NDIM*key.level())*sqrt(FunctionDefaults<NDIM>::get_cell_volume());
5310  fval = fast_transform(fval,quad_phiw,result,work).scale(scale);
5311 
5312  // Subtract to get the error ... the original coeffs are in the order k
5313  // basis but we just computed the coeffs in the order npt(=k+1) basis
5314  // so we can either use slices or an iterator macro.
5315  const tensorT coeff = node.coeff().full_tensor_copy();
5316  ITERATOR(coeff,fval(IND)-=coeff(IND););
5317  // flo note: we do want to keep a full tensor here!
5318 
5319  // Compute the norm of what remains
5320  double err = fval.normf();
5321  return err*err;
5322  }
5323 
5324  template <typename opT>
5325  class do_err_box {
5326  const implT* impl;
5327  const opT* func;
5328  int npt;
5329  Tensor<double> qx;
5330  Tensor<double> quad_phit;
5331  Tensor<double> quad_phiw;
5332  public:
5333  do_err_box() {}
5334 
5335  do_err_box(const implT* impl, const opT* func, int npt, const Tensor<double>& qx,
5336  const Tensor<double>& quad_phit, const Tensor<double>& quad_phiw)
5337  : impl(impl), func(func), npt(npt), qx(qx), quad_phit(quad_phit), quad_phiw(quad_phiw) {}
5338 
5339  do_err_box(const do_err_box& e)
5340  : impl(e.impl), func(e.func), npt(e.npt), qx(e.qx), quad_phit(e.quad_phit), quad_phiw(e.quad_phiw) {}
5341 
5342  double operator()(typename dcT::const_iterator& it) const {
5343  const keyT& key = it->first;
5344  const nodeT& node = it->second;
5345  if (node.has_coeff())
5346  return impl->err_box(key, node, *func, npt, qx, quad_phit, quad_phiw);
5347  else
5348  return 0.0;
5349  }
5350 
5351  double operator()(double a, double b) const {
5352  return a+b;
5353  }
5354 
5355  template <typename Archive>
5356  void serialize(const Archive& ar) {
5357  throw "not yet";
5358  }
5359  };
5360 
5361  /// Returns the sum of squares of errors from local info ... no comms
5362  template <typename opT>
5363  double errsq_local(const opT& func) const {
5364  PROFILE_MEMBER_FUNC(FunctionImpl);
5365  // Make quadrature rule of higher order
5366  const int npt = cdata.npt + 1;
5367  Tensor<double> qx, qw, quad_phi, quad_phiw, quad_phit;
5368  FunctionCommonData<T,NDIM>::_init_quadrature(k+1, npt, qx, qw, quad_phi, quad_phiw, quad_phit);
5369 
5370  typedef Range<typename dcT::const_iterator> rangeT;
5371  rangeT range(coeffs.begin(), coeffs.end());
5372  return world.taskq.reduce< double,rangeT,do_err_box<opT> >(range,
5373  do_err_box<opT>(this, &func, npt, qx, quad_phit, quad_phiw));
5374  }
5375 
5376  /// Returns \c int(f(x),x) in local volume
5377  T trace_local() const;
5378 
5379  struct do_norm2sq_local {
5380  double operator()(typename dcT::const_iterator& it) const {
5381  const nodeT& node = it->second;
5382  if (node.has_coeff()) {
5383  double norm = node.coeff().normf();
5384  return norm*norm;
5385  }
5386  else {
5387  return 0.0;
5388  }
5389  }
5390 
5391  double operator()(double a, double b) const {
5392  return (a+b);
5393  }
5394 
5395  template <typename Archive> void serialize(const Archive& ar) {
5396  throw "NOT IMPLEMENTED";
5397  }
5398  };
5399 
5400 
5401  /// Returns the square of the local norm ... no comms
5402  double norm2sq_local() const;
5403 
5404  /// compute the inner product of this range with other
5405  template<typename R>
5406  struct do_inner_local {
5407  const FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>* other;
5408  bool leaves_only;
5409  typedef TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) resultT;
5410 
5411  do_inner_local(const FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>* other, const bool leaves_only)
5412  : other(other), leaves_only(leaves_only) {}
5413  resultT operator()(typename dcT::const_iterator& it) const {
5414 
5415  TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) sum=0.0;
5416  const keyT& key=it->first;
5417  const nodeT& fnode = it->second;
5418  if (fnode.has_coeff()) {
5419  if (other->coeffs.probe(it->first)) {
5420  const FunctionNode<R,NDIM>& gnode = other->coeffs.find(key).get()->second;
5421  if (gnode.has_coeff()) {
5422  if (gnode.coeff().dim(0) != fnode.coeff().dim(0)) {
5423  madness::print("INNER", it->first, gnode.coeff().dim(0),fnode.coeff().dim(0));
5424  MADNESS_EXCEPTION("functions have different k or compress/reconstruct error", 0);
5425  }
5426  if (leaves_only) {
5427  if (gnode.is_leaf() or fnode.is_leaf()) {
5428  sum += fnode.coeff().trace_conj(gnode.coeff());
5429  }
5430  } else {
5431  sum += fnode.coeff().trace_conj(gnode.coeff());
5432  }
5433  }
5434  }
5435  }
5436  return sum;
5437  }
5438 
5439  resultT operator()(resultT a, resultT b) const {
5440  return (a+b);
5441  }
5442 
5443  template <typename Archive> void serialize(const Archive& ar) {
5444  throw "NOT IMPLEMENTED";
5445  }
5446  };
5447 
5448  /// Returns the inner product ASSUMING same distribution
5449 
5450  /// handles compressed and redundant form
5451  template <typename R>
5452  TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) inner_local(const FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>& g) const {
5453  PROFILE_MEMBER_FUNC(FunctionImpl);
5454  typedef Range<typename dcT::const_iterator> rangeT;
5455  typedef TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) resultT;
5456 
5457  // make sure the states of the trees are consistent
5458  MADNESS_ASSERT(this->is_redundant()==g.is_redundant());
5459  bool leaves_only=(this->is_redundant());
5460  return world.taskq.reduce<resultT,rangeT,do_inner_local<R> >
5461  (rangeT(coeffs.begin(),coeffs.end()),do_inner_local<R>(&g, leaves_only));
5462  }
5463 
5464 
5465  /// compute the inner product of this range with other
5466  template<typename R>
5467  struct do_inner_local_on_demand {
5468  const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>* bra;
5469  const FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>* ket;
5470  bool leaves_only=true;
5471  typedef TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) resultT;
5472 
5473  do_inner_local_on_demand(const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>* bra, const FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>* ket,
5474  const bool leaves_only=true)
5475  : bra(bra), ket(ket), leaves_only(leaves_only) {}
5476  resultT operator()(typename dcT::const_iterator& it) const {
5477 
5478  constexpr std::size_t LDIM=std::max(NDIM/2,std::size_t(1));
5479 
5480  const keyT& key=it->first;
5481  const nodeT& fnode = it->second;
5482  if (not fnode.has_coeff()) return resultT(0.0); // probably internal nodes
5483 
5484  // assuming all boxes (esp the low-dim ones) are local, i.e. the functions are replicated
5485  auto find_valid_parent = [](auto& key, auto& impl, auto&& find_valid_parent) {
5486  MADNESS_CHECK(impl->get_coeffs().owner(key)==impl->world.rank()); // make sure everything is local!
5487  if (impl->get_coeffs().probe(key)) return key;
5488  auto parentkey=key.parent();
5489  return find_valid_parent(parentkey, impl, find_valid_parent);
5490  };
5491 
5492  // returns coefficients, empty if no functor present
5493  auto get_coeff = [&find_valid_parent](const auto& key, const auto& v_impl) {
5494  if ((v_impl.size()>0) and v_impl.front().get()) {
5495  auto impl=v_impl.front();
5496 
5497 // bool have_impl=impl.get();
5498 // if (have_impl) {
5499  auto parentkey = find_valid_parent(key, impl, find_valid_parent);
5500  MADNESS_CHECK(impl->get_coeffs().probe(parentkey));
5501  typename decltype(impl->coeffs)::accessor acc;
5502  impl->get_coeffs().find(acc,parentkey);
5503  auto parentcoeff=acc->second.coeff();
5504  auto coeff=impl->parent_to_child(parentcoeff, parentkey, key);
5505  return coeff;
5506  } else {
5507  // get type of vector elements
5508  typedef typename std::decay_t<decltype(v_impl)>::value_type::element_type::typeT S;
5509 // typedef typename std::decay_t<decltype(v_impl)>::value_type S;
5510  return GenTensor<S>();
5511 // return GenTensor<typename std::decay_t<decltype(*impl)>::typeT>();
5512  }
5513  };
5514 
5515  auto make_vector = [](auto& arg) {
5516  return std::vector<std::decay_t<decltype(arg)>>(1,arg);
5517  };
5518 
5519 
5520  Key<LDIM> key1,key2;
5521  key.break_apart(key1,key2);
5522 
5523  auto func=dynamic_cast<CompositeFunctorInterface<R,NDIM,LDIM>* >(ket->functor.get());
5524  MADNESS_ASSERT(func);
5525 
5526  MADNESS_CHECK_THROW(func->impl_ket_vector.size()==0 or func->impl_ket_vector.size()==1,
5527  "only one ket function supported in inner_on_demand");
5528  MADNESS_CHECK_THROW(func->impl_p1_vector.size()==0 or func->impl_p1_vector.size()==1,
5529  "only one p1 function supported in inner_on_demand");
5530  MADNESS_CHECK_THROW(func->impl_p2_vector.size()==0 or func->impl_p2_vector.size()==1,
5531  "only one p2 function supported in inner_on_demand");
5532  auto coeff_bra=fnode.coeff();
5533  auto coeff_ket=get_coeff(key,func->impl_ket_vector);
5534  auto coeff_v1=get_coeff(key1,make_vector(func->impl_m1));
5535  auto coeff_v2=get_coeff(key2,make_vector(func->impl_m2));
5536  auto coeff_p1=get_coeff(key1,func->impl_p1_vector);
5537  auto coeff_p2=get_coeff(key2,func->impl_p2_vector);
5538 
5539  // construct |ket(1,2)> or |p(1)p(2)> or |p(1)p(2) ket(1,2)>
5540  double error=0.0;
5541  if (coeff_ket.has_data() and coeff_p1.has_data()) {
5542  pointwise_multiplier<LDIM> pm(key,coeff_ket);
5543  coeff_ket=pm(key,outer(coeff_p1,coeff_p2,TensorArgs(TT_FULL,-1.0)).full_tensor());
5544  error+=pm.error;
5545  } else if (coeff_ket.has_data() or coeff_p1.has_data()) {
5546  coeff_ket = (coeff_ket.has_data()) ? coeff_ket : outer(coeff_p1,coeff_p2);
5547  } else { // not ket and no p1p2
5548  MADNESS_EXCEPTION("confused ket/p1p2 in do_inner_local_on_demand",1);
5549  }
5550 
5551  // construct (v(1) + v(2)) |ket(1,2)>
5552  coeffT v1v2ket;
5553  if (coeff_v1.has_data()) {
5554  pointwise_multiplier<LDIM> pm(key,coeff_ket);
5555  v1v2ket = pm(key,coeff_v1.full_tensor(), 1);
5556  error+=pm.error;
5557  v1v2ket+= pm(key,coeff_v2.full_tensor(), 2);
5558  error+=pm.error;
5559  } else {
5560  v1v2ket = coeff_ket;
5561  }
5562 
5563  resultT result;
5564  if (func->impl_eri) { // project bra*ket onto eri, avoid multiplication with eri
5565  MADNESS_CHECK(func->impl_eri->get_functor()->provides_coeff());
5566  coeffT coeff_eri=func->impl_eri->get_functor()->coeff(key).full_tensor();
5567  pointwise_multiplier<LDIM> pm(key,v1v2ket);
5568  tensorT braket=pm(key,coeff_bra.full_tensor_copy().conj());
5569  error+=pm.error;
5570  if (error>1.e-3) print("error in key",key,error);
5571  result=coeff_eri.full_tensor().trace(braket);
5572 
5573  } else { // no eri, project ket onto bra
5574  result=coeff_bra.full_tensor_copy().trace_conj(v1v2ket.full_tensor_copy());
5575  }
5576  return result;
5577  }
5578 
5579  resultT operator()(resultT a, resultT b) const {
5580  return (a+b);
5581  }
5582 
5583  template <typename Archive> void serialize(const Archive& ar) {
5584  throw "NOT IMPLEMENTED";
5585  }
5586  };
5587 
5588  /// Returns the inner product of this with function g constructed on-the-fly
5589 
5590  /// the leaf boxes of this' MRA tree defines the inner product
5591  template <typename R>
5592  TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) inner_local_on_demand(const FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>& gimpl) const {
5593  PROFILE_MEMBER_FUNC(FunctionImpl);
5594  MADNESS_CHECK(this->is_reconstructed());
5595 
5596  typedef Range<typename dcT::const_iterator> rangeT;
5597  rangeT range(coeffs.begin(), coeffs.end());
5598  return world.taskq.reduce<T, rangeT, do_inner_local_on_demand<T>>(range,
5599  do_inner_local_on_demand<R>(this, &gimpl));
5600  }
5601 
5602  /// Type of the entry in the map returned by make_key_vec_map
5603  typedef std::vector< std::pair<int,const coeffT*> > mapvecT;
5604 
5605  /// Type of the map returned by make_key_vec_map
5606  typedef ConcurrentHashMap< keyT, mapvecT > mapT;
5607 
5608  /// Adds keys to union of local keys with specified index
5609  void add_keys_to_map(mapT* map, int index) const {
5610  typename dcT::const_iterator end = coeffs.end();
5611  for (typename dcT::const_iterator it=coeffs.begin(); it!=end; ++it) {
5612  typename mapT::accessor acc;
5613  const keyT& key = it->first;
5614  const FunctionNode<T,NDIM>& node = it->second;
5615  if (node.has_coeff()) {
5616  [[maybe_unused]] auto inserted = map->insert(acc,key);
5617  acc->second.push_back(std::make_pair(index,&(node.coeff())));
5618  }
5619  }
5620  }
5621 
5622  /// Returns map of union of local keys to vector of indexes of functions containing that key
5623 
5624  /// Local concurrency and synchronization only; no communication
5625  static
5626  mapT
5627  make_key_vec_map(const std::vector<const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>*>& v) {
5628  mapT map(100000);
5629  // This loop must be parallelized
5630  for (unsigned int i=0; i<v.size(); i++) {
5631  //v[i]->add_keys_to_map(&map,i);
5632  v[i]->world.taskq.add(*(v[i]), &FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>::add_keys_to_map, &map, int(i));
5633  }
5634  if (v.size()) v[0]->world.taskq.fence();
5635  return map;
5636  }
5637 
5638 #if HAVE_GENTENSOR
5639 // Original
5640  template <typename R>
5641  static void do_inner_localX(const typename mapT::iterator lstart,
5642  const typename mapT::iterator lend,
5643  typename FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::mapT* rmap_ptr,
5644  const bool sym,
5645  Tensor< TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) >* result_ptr,
5646  Mutex* mutex) {
5647  Tensor< TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) >& result = *result_ptr;
5648  Tensor< TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) > r(result.dim(0),result.dim(1));
5649  for (typename mapT::iterator lit=lstart; lit!=lend; ++lit) {
5650  const keyT& key = lit->first;
5651  typename FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::mapT::iterator rit=rmap_ptr->find(key);
5652  if (rit != rmap_ptr->end()) {
5653  const mapvecT& leftv = lit->second;
5654  const typename FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::mapvecT& rightv =rit->second;
5655  const int nleft = leftv.size();
5656  const int nright= rightv.size();
5657 
5658  for (int iv=0; iv<nleft; iv++) {
5659  const int i = leftv[iv].first;
5660  const GenTensor<T>* iptr = leftv[iv].second;
5661 
5662  for (int jv=0; jv<nright; jv++) {
5663  const int j = rightv[jv].first;
5664  const GenTensor<R>* jptr = rightv[jv].second;
5665 
5666  if (!sym || (sym && i<=j))
5667  r(i,j) += iptr->trace_conj(*jptr);
5668  }
5669  }
5670  }
5671  }
5672  mutex->lock();
5673  result += r;
5674  mutex->unlock();
5675  }
5676 #else
5677  template <typename R>
5678  static void do_inner_localX(const typename mapT::iterator lstart,
5679  const typename mapT::iterator lend,
5680  typename FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::mapT* rmap_ptr,
5681  const bool sym,
5682  Tensor< TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) >* result_ptr,
5683  Mutex* mutex) {
5684  Tensor< TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) >& result = *result_ptr;
5685  //Tensor< TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) > r(result.dim(0),result.dim(1));
5686  for (typename mapT::iterator lit=lstart; lit!=lend; ++lit) {
5687  const keyT& key = lit->first;
5688  typename FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::mapT::iterator rit=rmap_ptr->find(key);
5689  if (rit != rmap_ptr->end()) {
5690  const mapvecT& leftv = lit->second;
5691  const typename FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::mapvecT& rightv =rit->second;
5692  const size_t nleft = leftv.size();
5693  const size_t nright= rightv.size();
5694 
5695  unsigned int size = leftv[0].second->size();
5696  Tensor<T> Left(nleft, size);
5697  Tensor<R> Right(nright, size);
5698  Tensor< TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R)> r(nleft, nright);
5699  for(unsigned int iv = 0; iv < nleft; ++iv) Left(iv,_) = *(leftv[iv].second);
5700  for(unsigned int jv = 0; jv < nright; ++jv) Right(jv,_) = *(rightv[jv].second);
5701  // call mxmT from mxm.h in tensor
5702  if(TensorTypeData<T>::iscomplex) Left = Left.conj(); //Should handle complex case and leave real case alone
5703  mxmT(nleft, nright, size, r.ptr(), Left.ptr(), Right.ptr());
5704  mutex->lock();
5705  for(unsigned int iv = 0; iv < nleft; ++iv) {
5706  const int i = leftv[iv].first;
5707  for(unsigned int jv = 0; jv < nright; ++jv) {
5708  const int j = rightv[jv].first;
5709  if (!sym || (sym && i<=j)) result(i,j) += r(iv,jv);
5710  }
5711  }
5712  mutex->unlock();
5713  }
5714  }
5715  }
5716 #endif
5717 
5718  static double conj(float x) {
5719  return x;
5720  }
5721 
5722  static std::complex<double> conj(const std::complex<double> x) {
5723  return std::conj(x);
5724  }
5725 
5726  template <typename R>
5727  static Tensor< TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) >
5728  inner_local(const std::vector<const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>*>& left,
5729  const std::vector<const FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>*>& right,
5730  bool sym) {
5731 
5732  // This is basically a sparse matrix^T * matrix product
5733  // Rij = sum(k) Aki * Bkj
5734  // where i and j index functions and k index the wavelet coeffs
5735  // eventually the goal is this structure (don't have jtile yet)
5736  //
5737  // do in parallel tiles of k (tensors of coeffs)
5738  // do tiles of j
5739  // do i
5740  // do j in jtile
5741  // do k in ktile
5742  // Rij += Aki*Bkj
5743 
5744  mapT lmap = make_key_vec_map(left);
5745  typename FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::mapT rmap;
5746  typename FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::mapT* rmap_ptr = (typename FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::mapT*)(&lmap);
5747  if ((std::vector<const FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>*>*)(&left) != &right) {
5748  rmap = FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::make_key_vec_map(right);
5749  rmap_ptr = &rmap;
5750  }
5751 
5752  size_t chunk = (lmap.size()-1)/(3*4*5)+1;
5753 
5754  Tensor< TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) > r(left.size(), right.size());
5755  Mutex mutex;
5756 
5757  typename mapT::iterator lstart=lmap.begin();
5758  while (lstart != lmap.end()) {
5759  typename mapT::iterator lend = lstart;
5760  advance(lend,chunk);
5761  left[0]->world.taskq.add(&FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>::do_inner_localX<R>, lstart, lend, rmap_ptr, sym, &r, &mutex);
5762  lstart = lend;
5763  }
5764  left[0]->world.taskq.fence();
5765 
5766  if (sym) {
5767  for (long i=0; i<r.dim(0); i++) {
5768  for (long j=0; j<i; j++) {
5769  TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) sum = r(i,j)+conj(r(j,i));
5770  r(i,j) = sum;
5771  r(j,i) = conj(sum);
5772  }
5773  }
5774  }
5775  return r;
5776  }
5777 
5778  template <typename R>
5779  void print_type_in_compilation_error(R&&)
5780  {
5781  static_assert(!std::is_same<R, int>::value &&
5782  std::is_same<R, int>::value,
5783  "Compilation failed because you wanted to know the type; see below:");
5784  }
5785 
5786  /// invoked by result
5787 
5788  /// contract 2 functions f(x,z) = \int g(x,y) * h(y,z) dy
5789  /// @tparam CDIM: the dimension of the contraction variable (y)
5790  /// @tparam NDIM: the dimension of the result (x,z)
5791  /// @tparam LDIM: the dimension of g(x,y)
5792  /// @tparam KDIM: the dimension of h(y,z)
5793  template<typename Q, std::size_t LDIM, typename R, std::size_t KDIM,
5794  std::size_t CDIM = (KDIM + LDIM - NDIM) / 2>
5795  void partial_inner(const FunctionImpl<Q, LDIM>& g, const FunctionImpl<R, KDIM>& h,
5796  const std::array<int, CDIM> v1, const std::array<int, CDIM> v2) {
5797 
5798  typedef std::multimap<Key<NDIM>, std::list<Key<CDIM>>> contractionmapT;
5799  //double wall_get_lists=0.0;
5800  //double wall_recur=0.0;
5801  //double wall_contract=0.0;
5802  std::size_t nmax=FunctionDefaults<CDIM>::get_max_refine_level();
5803  const double thresh=FunctionDefaults<NDIM>::get_thresh();
5804 
5805  // auto print_map = [](const auto& map) {
5806  // for (const auto& kv : map) print(kv.first,"--",kv.second);
5807  // };
5808  // logical constness, not bitwise constness
5809  FunctionImpl<Q,LDIM>& g_nc=const_cast<FunctionImpl<Q,LDIM>&>(g);
5810  FunctionImpl<R,KDIM>& h_nc=const_cast<FunctionImpl<R,KDIM>&>(h);
5811 
5812  std::list<contractionmapT> all_contraction_maps;
5813  for (std::size_t n=0; n<nmax; ++n) {
5814 
5815  // list of nodes with d coefficients (and their parents)
5816  //double wall0 = wall_time();
5817  auto [g_ijlist, g_jlist] = g.get_contraction_node_lists(n, v1);
5818  auto [h_ijlist, h_jlist] = h.get_contraction_node_lists(n, v2);
5819  if ((g_ijlist.size() == 0) and (h_ijlist.size() == 0)) break;
5820  //double wall1 = wall_time();
5821  //wall_get_lists += (wall1 - wall0);
5822  //wall0 = wall1;
5823 // print("g_jlist");
5824 // for (const auto& kv : g_jlist) print(kv.first,kv.second);
5825 // print("h_jlist");
5826 // for (const auto& kv : h_jlist) print(kv.first,kv.second);
5827 
5828  // next lines will insert s nodes into g and h -> possible race condition!
5829  bool this_first = true; // are the remaining indices of g before those of g: f(x,z) = g(x,y) h(y,z)
5830  // CDIM, NDIM, KDIM
5831  contractionmapT contraction_map = g_nc.recur_down_for_contraction_map(
5832  g_nc.key0(), g_nc.get_coeffs().find(g_nc.key0()).get()->second, v1, v2,
5833  h_ijlist, h_jlist, this_first, thresh);
5834 
5835  this_first = false;
5836  // CDIM, NDIM, LDIM
5837  auto hnode0=h_nc.get_coeffs().find(h_nc.key0()).get()->second;
5838  contractionmapT contraction_map1 = h_nc.recur_down_for_contraction_map(
5839  h_nc.key0(), hnode0, v2, v1,
5840  g_ijlist, g_jlist, this_first, thresh);
5841 
5842  // will contain duplicate entries
5843  contraction_map.merge(contraction_map1);
5844  // turn multimap into a map of list
5845  auto it = contraction_map.begin();
5846  while (it != contraction_map.end()) {
5847  auto it_end = contraction_map.upper_bound(it->first);
5848  auto it2 = it;
5849  it2++;
5850  while (it2 != it_end) {
5851  it->second.splice(it->second.end(), it2->second);
5852  it2 = contraction_map.erase(it2);
5853  }
5854  it = it_end;
5855  }
5856 // print("thresh ",thresh);
5857 // print("contraction list size",contraction_map.size());
5858 
5859  // remove all double entries
5860  for (auto& elem: contraction_map) {
5861  elem.second.sort();
5862  elem.second.unique();
5863  }
5864  //wall1 = wall_time();
5865  //wall_recur += (wall1 - wall0);
5866 // if (n==2) {
5867 // print("contraction map for n=", n);
5868 // print_map(contraction_map);
5869 // }
5870  all_contraction_maps.push_back(contraction_map);
5871 
5872  long mapsize=contraction_map.size();
5873  if (mapsize==0) break;
5874  }
5875 
5876 
5877  // finally do the contraction
5878  for (const auto& contraction_map : all_contraction_maps) {
5879  for (const auto& key_list : contraction_map) {
5880  const Key<NDIM>& key=key_list.first;
5881  const std::list<Key<CDIM>>& list=key_list.second;
5882  woT::task(coeffs.owner(key), &implT:: template partial_inner_contract<Q,LDIM,R,KDIM>,
5883  &g,&h,v1,v2,key,list);
5884  }
5885  }
5886  }
5887 
5888  /// for contraction two functions f(x,z) = \int g(x,y) h(y,z) dy
5889 
5890  /// find all nodes with d coefficients and return a list of complete keys and of
5891  /// keys holding only the y dimension, also the maximum norm of all d for the j dimension
5892  /// @param[in] n the scale
5893  /// @param[in] v array holding the indices of the integration variable
5894  /// @return ijlist: list of all nodes with d coeffs; jlist: j-part of ij list only
5895  template<std::size_t CDIM>
5896  std::tuple<std::set<Key<NDIM>>, std::map<Key<CDIM>,double>>
5897  get_contraction_node_lists(const std::size_t n, const std::array<int, CDIM>& v) const {
5898 
5899  const auto& cdata=get_cdata();
5900  auto has_d_coeffs = [&cdata](const coeffT& coeff) {
5901  if (coeff.has_no_data()) return false;
5902  return (coeff.dim(0)==2*cdata.k);
5903  };
5904 
5905  // keys to be contracted in g
5906  std::set<Key<NDIM>> ij_list; // full key
5907  std::map<Key<CDIM>,double> j_list; // only that dimension that will be contracted
5908 
5909  for (auto it=get_coeffs().begin(); it!=get_coeffs().end(); ++it) {
5910  const Key<NDIM>& key=it->first;
5911  const FunctionNode<T,NDIM>& node=it->second;
5912  if ((key.level()==n) and (has_d_coeffs(node.coeff()))) {
5913  ij_list.insert(key);
5914  Vector<Translation,CDIM> j_trans;
5915  for (std::size_t i=0; i<CDIM; ++i) j_trans[i]=key.translation()[v[i]];
5916  Key<CDIM> jkey(n,j_trans);
5917  const double max_d_norm=j_list[jkey];
5918  j_list.insert_or_assign(jkey,std::max(max_d_norm,node.get_dnorm()));
5919  Key<CDIM> parent_jkey=jkey.parent();
5920  while (j_list.count(parent_jkey)==0) {
5921  j_list.insert({parent_jkey,1.0});
5922  parent_jkey=parent_jkey.parent();
5923  }
5924  }
5925  }
5926  return std::make_tuple(ij_list,j_list);
5927  }
5928 
5929  /// make a map of all nodes that will contribute to a partial inner product
5930 
5931  /// given the list of d coefficient-holding nodes of the other function:
5932  /// recur down h if snorm * dnorm > tol and key n−jx ∈ other−ij-list. Make s
5933  /// coefficients if necessary. Make list of nodes n − ijk as map(n-ik, list(j)).
5934  ///
5935  /// !! WILL ADD NEW S NODES TO THIS TREE THAT MUST BE REMOVED TO AVOID INCONSISTENT TREE STRUCTURE !!
5936  ///
5937  /// @param[in] key for recursion
5938  /// @param[in] node corresponds to key
5939  /// @param[in] v_this this' dimension that are contracted
5940  /// @param[in] v_other other's dimension that are contracted
5941  /// @param[in] ij_other_list list of nodes of the other function that will be contracted (and their parents)
5942  /// @param[in] j_other_list list of column nodes of the other function that will be contracted (and their parents)
5943  /// @param[in] max_d_norm max d coeff norm of the nodes in j_list
5944  /// @param[in] this_first are the remaining coeffs of this functions first or last in the result function
5945  /// @param[in] thresh threshold for including nodes in the contraction: snorm*dnorm > thresh
5946  /// @tparam CDIM dimension to be contracted
5947  /// @tparam ODIM dimensions of the other function
5948  /// @tparam FDIM dimensions of the final function
5949  template<std::size_t CDIM, std::size_t ODIM, std::size_t FDIM=NDIM+ODIM-2*CDIM>
5950  std::multimap<Key<FDIM>, std::list<Key<CDIM>>> recur_down_for_contraction_map(
5951  const keyT& key, const nodeT& node,
5952  const std::array<int,CDIM>& v_this,
5953  const std::array<int,CDIM>& v_other,
5954  const std::set<Key<ODIM>>& ij_other_list,
5955  const std::map<Key<CDIM>,double>& j_other_list,
5956  bool this_first, const double thresh) {
5957 
5958  std::multimap<Key<FDIM>, std::list<Key<CDIM>>> contraction_map;
5959 
5960  // fast return if the other function has no d coeffs
5961  if (j_other_list.empty()) return contraction_map;
5962 
5963  // continue recursion if this node may be contracted with the j column
5964  // extract relevant node translations from this node
5965  const auto j_this_key=key.extract_key(v_this);
5966 
5967 // print("\nkey, j_this_key", key, j_this_key);
5968  const double max_d_norm=j_other_list.find(j_this_key)->second;
5969  const bool sd_norm_product_large = node.get_snorm() * max_d_norm > truncate_tol(thresh,key);
5970 // print("sd_product_norm",node.get_snorm() * max_d_norm, thresh);
5971 
5972  // end recursion if we have reached the final scale n
5973  // with which nodes from other will this node be contracted?
5974  bool final_scale=key.level()==ij_other_list.begin()->level();
5975  if (final_scale and sd_norm_product_large) {
5976  for (auto& other_key : ij_other_list) {
5977  const auto j_other_key=other_key.extract_key(v_other);
5978  if (j_this_key != j_other_key) continue;
5979  auto i_key=key.extract_complement_key(v_this);
5980  auto k_key=other_key.extract_complement_key(v_other);
5981 // print("key, ij_other_key",key,other_key);
5982 // print("i, k, j key",i_key, k_key, j_this_key);
5983  Key<FDIM> ik_key=(this_first) ? i_key.merge_with(k_key) : k_key.merge_with(i_key);
5984 // print("ik_key",ik_key);
5985 // MADNESS_CHECK(contraction_map.count(ik_key)==0);
5986  contraction_map.insert(std::make_pair(ik_key,std::list<Key<CDIM>>{j_this_key}));
5987  }
5988  return contraction_map;
5989  }
5990 
5991  bool continue_recursion = (j_other_list.count(j_this_key)==1);
5992  if (not continue_recursion) return contraction_map;
5993 
5994 
5995  // continue recursion if norms are large
5996  continue_recursion = (node.has_children() or sd_norm_product_large);
5997 
5998  if (continue_recursion) {
5999  // in case we need to compute children's coefficients: unfilter only once
6000  bool compute_child_s_coeffs=true;
6001  coeffT d = node.coeff();
6002 // print("continuing recursion from key",key);
6003 
6004  for (KeyChildIterator<NDIM> kit(key); kit; ++kit) {
6005  keyT child=kit.key();
6006  typename dcT::accessor acc;
6007 
6008  // make child's s coeffs if it doesn't exist or if is has no s coeffs
6009  bool childnode_exists=get_coeffs().find(acc,child);
6010  bool need_s_coeffs= childnode_exists ? (acc->second.get_snorm()<=0.0) : true;
6011 
6012  coeffT child_s_coeffs;
6013  if (need_s_coeffs and compute_child_s_coeffs) {
6014  if (d.dim(0)==cdata.vk[0]) { // s coeffs only in this node
6015  coeffT d1(cdata.v2k,get_tensor_args());
6016  d1(cdata.s0)+=d;
6017  d=d1;
6018  }
6019  d = unfilter(d);
6020  child_s_coeffs=copy(d(child_patch(child)));
6021  child_s_coeffs.reduce_rank(thresh);
6022  compute_child_s_coeffs=false;
6023  }
6024 
6025  if (not childnode_exists) {
6026  get_coeffs().replace(child,nodeT(child_s_coeffs,false));
6027  get_coeffs().find(acc,child);
6028  } else if (childnode_exists and need_s_coeffs) {
6029  acc->second.coeff()=child_s_coeffs;
6030  }
6031  bool exists= get_coeffs().find(acc,child);
6032  MADNESS_CHECK(exists);
6033  nodeT& childnode = acc->second;
6034  if (need_s_coeffs) childnode.recompute_snorm_and_dnorm(get_cdata());
6035 // print("recurring down to",child);
6036  contraction_map.merge(recur_down_for_contraction_map(child,childnode, v_this, v_other,
6037  ij_other_list, j_other_list, this_first, thresh));
6038 // print("contraction_map.size()",contraction_map.size());
6039  }
6040 
6041  }
6042 
6043  return contraction_map;
6044  }
6045 
6046 
6047  /// tensor contraction part of partial_inner
6048 
6049  /// @param[in] g rhs of the inner product
6050  /// @param[in] h lhs of the inner product
6051  /// @param[in] v1 dimensions of g to be contracted
6052  /// @param[in] v2 dimensions of h to be contracted
6053  /// @param[in] key key of result's (this) FunctionNode
6054  /// @param[in] j_key_list list of contraction index-j keys contributing to this' node
6055  template<typename Q, std::size_t LDIM, typename R, std::size_t KDIM,
6056  std::size_t CDIM = (KDIM + LDIM - NDIM) / 2>
6057  void partial_inner_contract(const FunctionImpl<Q, LDIM>* g, const FunctionImpl<R, KDIM>* h,
6058  const std::array<int, CDIM> v1, const std::array<int, CDIM> v2,
6059  const Key<NDIM>& key, const std::list<Key<CDIM>>& j_key_list) {
6060 
6061  Key<LDIM - CDIM> i_key;
6062  Key<KDIM - CDIM> k_key;
6063  key.break_apart(i_key, k_key);
6064 
6065  coeffT result_coeff(get_cdata().v2k, get_tensor_type());
6066  for (const auto& j_key: j_key_list) {
6067 
6068  auto v_complement = [](const auto& v, const auto& vc) {
6069  constexpr std::size_t VDIM = std::tuple_size<std::decay_t<decltype(v)>>::value;
6070  constexpr std::size_t VCDIM = std::tuple_size<std::decay_t<decltype(vc)>>::value;
6071  std::array<int, VCDIM> result;
6072  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < VCDIM; i++) result[i] = (v.back() + i + 1) % (VDIM + VCDIM);
6073  return result;
6074  };
6075  auto make_ij_key = [&v_complement](const auto i_key, const auto j_key, const auto& v) {
6076  constexpr std::size_t IDIM = std::decay_t<decltype(i_key)>::static_size;
6077  constexpr std::size_t JDIM = std::decay_t<decltype(j_key)>::static_size;
6078  static_assert(JDIM == std::tuple_size<std::decay_t<decltype(v)>>::value);
6079 
6080  Vector<Translation, IDIM + JDIM> l;
6081  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < v.size(); ++i) l[v[i]] = j_key.translation()[i];
6082  std::array<int, IDIM> vc1;
6083  auto vc = v_complement(v, vc1);
6084  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < vc.size(); ++i) l[vc[i]] = i_key.translation()[i];
6085 
6086  return Key<IDIM + JDIM>(i_key.level(), l);
6087  };
6088 
6089  Key<LDIM> ij_key = make_ij_key(i_key, j_key, v1);
6090  Key<KDIM> jk_key = make_ij_key(k_key, j_key, v2);
6091 
6092  MADNESS_CHECK(g->get_coeffs().probe(ij_key));
6093  MADNESS_CHECK(h->get_coeffs().probe(jk_key));
6094  const coeffT& gcoeff = g->get_coeffs().find(ij_key).get()->second.coeff();
6095  const coeffT& hcoeff = h->get_coeffs().find(jk_key).get()->second.coeff();
6096  coeffT gcoeff1, hcoeff1;
6097  if (gcoeff.dim(0) == g->get_cdata().k) {
6098  gcoeff1 = coeffT(g->get_cdata().v2k, g->get_tensor_args());
6099  gcoeff1(g->get_cdata().s0) += gcoeff;
6100  } else {
6101  gcoeff1 = gcoeff;
6102  }
6103  if (hcoeff.dim(0) == g->get_cdata().k) {
6104  hcoeff1 = coeffT(h->get_cdata().v2k, h->get_tensor_args());
6105  hcoeff1(h->get_cdata().s0) += hcoeff;
6106  } else {
6107  hcoeff1 = hcoeff;
6108  }
6109 
6110  // offset: 0 for full tensor, 1 for svd representation with rand being the first dimension (r,d1,d2,d3) -> (r,d1*d2*d3)
6111  auto fuse = [](Tensor<T> tensor, const std::array<int, CDIM>& v, int offset) {
6112  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < CDIM - 1; ++i) {
6113  MADNESS_CHECK((v[i] + 1) == v[i + 1]); // make sure v is contiguous and ascending
6114  tensor = tensor.fusedim(v[0]+offset);
6115  }
6116  return tensor;
6117  };
6118 
6119  // use case: partial_projection of 2-electron functions in svd representation f(1) = \int g(2) h(1,2) d2
6120  // c_i = \sum_j a_j b_ij = \sum_jr a_j b_rj b'_rj
6121  // = \sum_jr ( a_j b_rj) b'_rj )
6122  auto contract2 = [](const auto& svdcoeff, const auto& tensor, const int particle) {
6123 #if HAVE_GENTENSOR
6124  const int spectator_particle=(particle+1)%2;
6125  Tensor<Q> gtensor = svdcoeff.get_svdtensor().make_vector_with_weights(particle);
6126  gtensor=gtensor.reshape(svdcoeff.rank(),gtensor.size()/svdcoeff.rank());
6127  MADNESS_CHECK(gtensor.ndim()==2);
6128  Tensor<Q> gtensor_other = svdcoeff.get_svdtensor().ref_vector(spectator_particle);
6129  Tensor<T> tmp1=inner(gtensor,tensor.flat(),1,0); // tmp1(r) = sum_j a'_(r,j) b(j)
6130  MADNESS_CHECK(tmp1.ndim()==1);
6131  Tensor<T> tmp2=inner(gtensor_other,tmp1,0,0); // tmp2(i) = sum_r a_(r,i) tmp1(r)
6132  return tmp2;
6133 #else
6134  MADNESS_EXCEPTION("no partial_inner using svd without GenTensor",1);
6135  return Tensor<T>();
6136 #endif
6137  };
6138 
6139  if (gcoeff.is_full_tensor() and hcoeff.is_full_tensor() and result_coeff.is_full_tensor()) {
6140  // merge multiple contraction dimensions into one
6141  int offset = 0;
6142  Tensor<Q> gtensor = fuse(gcoeff1.full_tensor(), v1, offset);
6143  Tensor<R> htensor = fuse(hcoeff1.full_tensor(), v2, offset);
6144  result_coeff.full_tensor() += inner(gtensor, htensor, v1[0], v2[0]);
6145  if (key.level() > 0) {
6146  gtensor = copy(gcoeff1.full_tensor()(g->get_cdata().s0));
6147  htensor = copy(hcoeff1.full_tensor()(h->get_cdata().s0));
6148  gtensor = fuse(gtensor, v1, offset);
6149  htensor = fuse(htensor, v2, offset);
6150  result_coeff.full_tensor()(get_cdata().s0) -= inner(gtensor, htensor, v1[0], v2[0]);
6151  }
6152  }
6153 
6154 
6155  // use case: 2-electron functions in svd representation f(1,3) = \int g(1,2) h(2,3) d2
6156  // c_ik = \sum_j a_ij b_jk = \sum_jrr' a_ri a'_rj b_r'j b_r'k
6157  // = \sum_jrr' ( a_ri (a'_rj b_r'j) ) b_r'k
6158  // = \sum_jrr' c_r'i b_r'k
6159  else if (gcoeff.is_svd_tensor() and hcoeff.is_svd_tensor() and result_coeff.is_svd_tensor()) {
6160  MADNESS_CHECK(v1[0]==0 or v1[CDIM-1]==LDIM-1);
6161  MADNESS_CHECK(v2[0]==0 or v2[CDIM-1]==KDIM-1);
6162  int gparticle= v1[0]==0 ? 0 : 1; // which particle to integrate over
6163  int hparticle= v2[0]==0 ? 0 : 1; // which particle to integrate over
6164  // merge multiple contraction dimensions into one
6165  Tensor<Q> gtensor = gcoeff1.get_svdtensor().flat_vector_with_weights(gparticle);
6166  Tensor<Q> gtensor_other = gcoeff1.get_svdtensor().flat_vector((gparticle+1)%2);
6167  Tensor<R> htensor = hcoeff1.get_svdtensor().flat_vector_with_weights(hparticle);
6168  Tensor<R> htensor_other = hcoeff1.get_svdtensor().flat_vector((hparticle+1)%2);
6169  Tensor<T> tmp1=inner(gtensor,htensor,1,1); // tmp1(r,r') = sum_j b(r,j) a(r',j)
6170  Tensor<T> tmp2=inner(tmp1,gtensor_other,0,0); // tmp2(r',i) = sum_r tmp1(r,r') a(r,i)
6171  Tensor< typename Tensor<T>::scalar_type > w(tmp2.dim(0));
6172  MADNESS_CHECK(tmp2.dim(0)==htensor_other.dim(0));
6173  w=1.0;
6174  coeffT result_tmp(get_cdata().v2k, get_tensor_type());
